page.title: 14RECREATION
page.content: RECREATION. CANAL HEAD. The Pocklington Canal Amenities Society, has been co-ordinating the Canal's restoration since 1969. The Canal covers 9 miles, from the York/Hull road, to the River Derwent at East Cottingwith, and will soon be open to navigation by barges for 5 miles as far as Melbourne. The swing-bridges are to be erected by the Society, on foundations which will be built by The British Waterways Board. Two fixed bridges are to be dismantled The remaining 4 mile stretch, which includes 7 of the Canal's 9 locks is at present used only be pleasure boats. The British Waterways Board are dredging the canal basin at Canal Head The old lock/keeper's house is a cafe, and the approach road has been planted on each side with Silver Birch.In l823 The Union Packet (carrier)sailed daily
